item.title: How to Host Your Resume on Github
item.description:
I am writing this as blog post to show how I managed to make my Overleaf resume host on github then automatically update to my website. This guide assumes that you are hosting your website using Github Pages (although other website hosting wervices should work with this also).

##1. Host Your Resume on Overleaf This is entirely optional, but I prefer to edit my Latex documents on Overleaf.

Once you have your resume on Latex

You can configure your Overleaf project to sync directly with a repository on GitHub, or you can use raw git access as described below.

To sync your project directly with GitHub, open your project, go to the Menu in the top left, and choose GitHub from the Sync section. Then follow the prompts.
